page.title: 01Over Whitacre/Farms & Woods
page.content: This sparsely populated undulating area is predominantly Grade 2 Agricultural land of medium loam overlying Kupar Marl and sandstone on the North Warwicks coalfield. The settlement is of established farmsteads and cottages. Farming is mainly mixed, cereals grown are barley and wheat with potatoes and some oilseed rape as break crops. Farms are mainly owner occupied averag ing 80h.a. Traditional dairy farms have expanded recently some giving way to beef and sheep units. There are outlying deciduous woodlands, some of which (viz Hore Park) are remnants of the ancient forest of Arden Apart from agriculture residents are employed in industry and commute by car to Birmingham and Coventry. Others are miners at Daw Mill (Se) and Baddesley (N) Mines.
